definition: to go back on a marriage contract/to repudiate an engagement
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: Her father will be furious if you try to back out of the marriage now.
sentences.chinese: 如果你现在想赖婚，她父亲一定会火冒三丈。

definition: to break a promise of marriage
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to make a pledge to be married, without parents' approval
(dialect) form of address for one's wife/polite form of address for a woman
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
lit. the raw rice is now cooked (idiom); fig. it is done and can't be changed/It's too late to change anything now./also written 生米煮成熟飯|生米煮成熟饭
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zuo4 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: Ximen Qing, character from 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2] and 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
